summary: This is an automated out-of-office email reply from a prosecutor (likely AUSA Maurene Comey) indicating they are on trial before Judge Ronnie Abrams in the case United States v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB). It provides contact information for urgent matters related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Ronnie Abrams
persons.context: Presiding judge over the trial where the email sender is currently appearing.

persons.name: AUSA Maurene Comey
persons.context: Inferred as the likely sender of the email based on the signature and the case reference; indicates they are on trial and provides contact instructions for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named defendant in the criminal case United States v. Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB), which is the subject of the email.

connections.description: Comey is a prosecutor working on the criminal case against Epstein.
Abrams is the presiding judge in the criminal case against Epstein.
Comey is appearing before Judge Abrams in a trial.

events.title: Prosecutor Out-of-Office Notification
events.description: AUSA Maurene Comey sends an automatic email reply stating they are on trial before Judge Ronnie Abrams and provides contact instructions for the Epstein case.

events.title: Criminal Case United States v. Epstein
events.description: Ongoing federal criminal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein under docket number 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).

keyFacts: The email confirms an active criminal trial was proceeding in the case United States v. Epstein (19 Cr. 490) as of August 2019.
The Honorable Ronnie Abrams was the presiding judge in the Epstein case at that time.
AUSA Maurene Comey was a prosecutor involved in the Epstein case and was on trial in another matter before Judge Abrams.
The document is an automated out-of-office reply, indicating the busy trial schedule of the prosecution team handling the Epstein case.
